poem:
The Borrowed Breath

In the quiet theater of twilight,  
a pig's lung finds a home,  
expanding softly in the chest  
of a dreaming, brain-silenced host.  
For nine days, it whispers secrets—  
a xenotransplanted melody,  
reminding us that even borrowed air  
can sustain the delicate dance  
of life, fleeting as it is.
